Surgery expected to end Carl Crawford's season

Red Sox outfielder Carl Crawford could undergo season-ending Tommy John surgery as early as Wednesday to repair a torn elbow ligament. A final decision by the team is expected later today. (Boston Globe)
  • Discuss Your thoughts on the expected surgery

Airlines cut legroom to help boost profits

Some airlines are squeezing seats closer together in order to pack in more passengers, creating rows with extra legroom for people willing to pay more, or both. (Globe)

Milford is about to become the first town in New England to partner with federal immigration officials to prevent the hiring of illegal immigrants. (AP, 9 a.m.)
